headline.main: In Final Address, Obama Touts Values and Prods Trump
headline.print_headline: In Final Address, Obama Touts Values and Prods Trump

docs.lead_paragraph: With a final shout of his campaign mantra "Yes We Can," President Barack Obama on Tuesday urged Americans to stand up for U.S. values and reject discrimination as the country transitions to the presidency of Republican Donald Trump.

headline.main: Trump Tweets 'Iran Is Playing With Fire', Says Won't Be as Kind as Obama
headline.print_headline: Trump Tweets 'Iran Is Playing With Fire', Says Won't Be as Kind as Obama

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted early on Friday that "Iran is playing with fire" and "they don't appreciate how kind President Obama was to them. Not me!"

headline.main: Obama Pushes Values and Prods Trump in Final, Emotional Address
headline.print_headline: Obama Pushes Values and Prods Trump in Final, Emotional Address

docs.lead_paragraph: With a final call of his campaign mantra "Yes We Can," President Barack Obama urged Americans on Tuesday to stand up for U.S. values and reject discrimination as the United States transitions to the presidency of Republican Donald Trump.

headline.main: Obama Presses Trump Not to Back Away From Clean Energy
headline.print_headline: Obama Presses Trump Not to Back Away From Clean Energy

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama cast the adoption of clean energy in the U.S. as "irreversible," putting pressure Monday on President-elect Donald Trump not to back away from a core strategy to fight climate change.
